key_points: Tampa Bay Buccaneers are the defending Super Bowl champions.
Season pass holders will see ticket prices increase from 10 to 45 percent for the 2021 season.
Ticket price increase follows a significant demand surge after signing Tom Brady in 2020.
Elimination of 3,000 seats in the 300 level, previously offered at half price to youths, contributes to the highest increase.
Bucs Chief Operating Officer Brian Ford cited over $150 million in stadium renovations and alignment with league pricing models as reasons for the increase.
Despite increases, the Bucs claim to offer one of the most affordable average ticket prices in the NFL.
The 2020 season saw limited fan attendance at games due to pandemic restrictions, with stadium capacity at about 15,600.
Bruce Arians and Jason Licht described winning a Super Bowl during a pandemic as a "daunting task" in their letter.
The team aims to fill the 65,000-seat Raymond James Stadium for the 2021 season.
The secondary market for Bucs tickets in the next season could see even higher price increases.
